issue.title: open.spotify.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2F) ### Comment > Spotify player gets stuck on ads sometimes on web player with AdGuard enabled - no songs, nothing, not even ad plays. Only solution is to refresh the browser and replay the playlist. Trying to change playlist doesn't work either, completely stuck playerand now playing view. While with AdGuard disabled, ads load normally and player works as intended. One important thing: It happens after 2-3 times ads are skipped. e.g I open player, play a playlist, ads come normally due course, gets skipped twice or even thrice, songs playing uninterrupted, after that it gets stuck on ad and nothing plays. Like spotify detects adblocker is on after 2-3 skips and blocks plays (guess). ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/83mi74u948w0g4kgws88k0sg8g8k4sg9pssix2rkdg.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/2vay4knk3su8oowwo0ko4og4c880sgonwbv61x27r4.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.2.500.7 MV3 System version: | `Windows 11` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,

issue.title: open.spotify.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2F) ### Comment > Spotify player gets stuck on ads sometimes on web player with AdGuard enabled - no songs, nothing, not even ad plays. Only solution is to refresh the browser and replay the playlist. Trying to change playlist doesn't work either, completely stuck playerand now playing view. While with AdGuard disabled, ads load normally and player works as intended. One important thing: It happens after 2-3 times ads are skipped. e.g I open player, play a playlist, ads come normally due course, gets skipped twice or even thrice, songs playing uninterrupted, after that it gets stuck on ad and nothing plays. Like spotify detects adblocker is on after 2-3 skips and blocks plays (guess). ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/5utfr3dywvocowow4g4gckw4ogoswkodlb2yh749tc.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/oyua20ko00g8o8880oko8sc4koc0wo0izgbu4ci99c.png?nc=1)

comment.body:
Please let me know what youd like me to do.  I need this site to work consistently.  Im just not sure how to help right now since its working sometimes and not others.  

 

 

From: Nguyen Nguyen ***@***.***> 
Sent: Sunday, January 4, 2026 6:26 AM
To: AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters ***@***.***>
Cc: JackLGM ***@***.***>; Comment ***@***.***>
Subject: Re: [AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters] mytotalconnectcomfort.com (Issue #221469)

 

  <https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/23257168?s=20&v=4> ntnguyen1234 left a comment (AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters#221469) <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/221469#issuecomment-3708042410> 

Yeah, this is just a test. Since I couldn't reproduce the issue, I need to narrow down which filter or section causes issue on your side.

If the issue is inconsistent, it might be difficult to test though.


Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/221469#issuecomment-3708042410> , or unsubscribe <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AM7ZHAGXPMB63YEPNEGYQQT4FEBHFAVCNFSM6AAAAACQLH5AKSVHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMZTOMBYGA2DENBRGA> .

comment.body:
I can, but I have a couple of questions about that:

1.	Would I then have to leave that off all the time?  Id prefer to be able to use that feature for other sites.  Or is this just a test?  
2.	At the moment the site is working normally so I wouldnt be able to tell if turning off tracking protection affects anything.  Its being really inconsistent about working sometimes and not working at other times.  

I can turn it off the next time it stops working and let you know if that helps if youd like?

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". comment.body: @Alex-302 can we add events.split.io? It's definitely used for tracking
i ain't repeat anything ,i don't see any playable content `watch.spencerdevs.xyz`, all i see is
The reason for adding it to that rule is that they rotate ad server domains, so it's a better long term fix.

> is there content on website? is it usable?

I'm talking about `watch.spencerdevs.xyz`.

Example: `spencerdevs.xyz,dustebin.com#%#//scriptlet('prevent-addEventListener', '/^(?:click|touchend)$/', 'window[_0x')`
is there content on website? is it usable?

> ok missed update

You could add this to the rule: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/b9d41b55b877761dcc00a7b256601987632385fb/BaseFilter/sections/specific.txt#L909

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/221284#issuecomment-3708106254
See https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/218893#issuecomment-3591792435 and add
```
web.nhk#%#//scriptlet('trusted-set-cookie', 'consentToUse', '{"status":"optedin","entity":"household","area":{"areaId":"130","jisx0402":"13113","postal":"1508001","pref":"13"}}')
web.nhk#%#//scriptlet('trusted-set-cookie', 'efm', '{"sd":"2025-10-01T00:00:00.000Z","ed":"2050-12-31T23:59:59.999Z"}')
```

to User rules.

comment.body:
> you need to enable **adguard cookie notices** filter from adguard app

I shouldn't need to. I have the Annoyances filter enabled, which includes the Cookie notice filter.
"Annoyances filter blocks irritating elements on web pages. View rules. Includes the following AdGuard filters (all of them can be enabled separately from the Annoyances filter):

Cookie Notices blocks cookie notices on web pages. View rules"
